Literature Review: Neurotechnologies for treating pain have gained significant attention in recent years due to their potential to provide effective relief for individuals suffering from chronic pain. Electrical stimulation of the central or peripheral nervous system is the underlying principle behind these technologies, which have been commercialized to treat a variety of pain conditions. This review aims to provide an overview of the pain conditions commonly treated with electrical stimulation, the specific neurotechnologies used for treating those conditions, and the barriers to adoption. We will also discuss design improvements and cutting-edge technologies that may address the limitations of existing neurotechnologies.
